s1: An introductory course in formal logic, dealing with propositional and predicate logic.
s2: A practically oriented introduction to programming paradigms for parallel computers.

s1: Techniques of formal deduction and tests for the validity of arguments will be studied.
s2: Demonstrate advanced knowledge of the elements of parallel programming language and system implementation.

s1: Basic semantic concepts will be discussed.
s2: Recall the history of parallel systems and describe the developments in the field.

s1: Express reasoning problems using first order logical notation.
s2: Demonstrate advanced knowledge of the elements of parallel programming language and system implementation.

s1: Construct natural deduction proofs in first order logic and translate between calculi.
s2: Demonstrate advanced knowledge of the elements of parallel programming language and system implementation.

s1: Explain the relationship between rules of deduction and the semantics of logic.
s2: Demonstrate advanced knowledge of the elements of parallel programming language and system implementation.

s1: Critically assess and compare philosophical views on issues arising from elementary logic.
s2: Recall the history of parallel systems and describe the developments in the field.
